sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation concerning buildings, and inmates, within the citie of London, and confines of the same. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
4 sheets.
By Bonham Norton and Iohn Bill, printers to the Kings most excellent Maiestie, Printed at London : M.DC.XXV. [1625]
Caption title. Dated at end: White-Hall, the second day of May, in the first yeere of His Maiesties reigne .. Imprint from colophon. Arms 21; Steele notation: State, iesties 2) of 3) And 4) become brought. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

4 sheets.
By Bonham Norton and Iohn Bill, printers to the Kings most excellent Maiestie, Printed at London : M.DC.XXV. [1625]
Caption title. Dated at end: White-Hall, the second day of May, in the first yeere of His Maiesties reigne .. Imprint from colophon. Arms 21; Steele notation: State, iesties 2) of 3) And 4) become brought. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
